title: Remittances tax: How Trump's 'Big Beautiful Bill’ may turn out to be ugly for Indians in US
content: A proposed US bill, dubbed 'The One Big Beautiful Bill,' could impose a 3.5% remittance tax on money transfers from the US to India by 2026, impacting Indian immigrants, including H-1B visa holders and permanent residents. This legislation, awaiting Senate approval, may significantly increase the financial burden on the Indian community, potentially costing them over a billion dollars annually.

title: US halts new student visa interviews amid plans for social media screening
content: The U.S. has temporarily suspended new student visa interviews worldwide, signaling stricter social media checks under the Trump administration. This move, outlined in a diplomatic cable by Secretary of State Marco Rubio, raises concerns among international applicants. It follows previous actions targeting foreign students and universities, citing national security and campus unrest as justification.

title: With 100 SUVs & 10,000 supporters, Brij Bhushan holds 'victory parade'
content: Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, the former WFI chief, declared his vindication after a Delhi court accepted a closure report in a Pocso case against him. Speaking in Ayodhya, where he received a grand welcome, Singh asserted his faith in the judiciary and called for measures to prevent the misuse of sexual harassment laws, emphasizing that truth prevails.

title: 'No one helped us': What lead to the suicide pact of family of 7 in Panchkula
content: In a tragic incident in Panchkula, Praveen Mittal and his family of six were found dead in their car, victims of suspected suicide due to overwhelming financial debts. Praveen, visibly distraught, confessed to their dire situation before collapsing, leaving the community in shock.

title: IPL 2025: RCB beat LSG, to face PBKS in Qualifier 1
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) defeated Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in a high-scoring match. LSG scored 227/3, led by Rishabh Pant's century. RCB chased the target, finishing at 231/3. Virat Kohli scored 54, and RCB's captain hit an unbeaten 85. RCB secured a top-two position and will play Punjab Kings in Qualifier 1.

title: Trump to Apple: Okay, you go to India but you're not going to sell in US without ...
content: President Trump is pushing Apple to manufacture iPhones in the United States, threatening a 25% tariff on imported products if they continue production in India. Trump expressed his desire for Apple to prioritize domestic manufacturing, even though India has offered tariff-free deals.

title: OPT Students in US face deportation threat over employment data lapse
content: International students in the US on OPT are facing potential deportation due to stricter enforcement of SEVIS reporting rules. ICE is issuing letters threatening termination for those not promptly updating employment information, particularly regarding unemployment days.

title: Nagpur woman repatriated by Pak could be arrested
content: Sunita Bholeshwar Jamgade, a Nagpur woman, crossed the Line of Control at Kargil and was later repatriated. An Amritsar police registered a zero FIR against her under the Official Secrets Act, suspecting espionage. Authorities plan to investigate her potential involvement and may arrest her. She was in contact with two people in Pakistan and crossed the border to meet them.

title: Omar Abdullah says J&K will build memorial to 26 killed in Baisaran meadow
content: Following the tragic terrorist attack in Baisaran meadow, the J&K government, led by CM Omar Abdullah, has announced the construction of a memorial to honour the 26 victims. Aiming to restore tourist confidence, the cabinet meeting cleared the memorial in Baisaran — about 7km from Pahalgam and reachable either on foot or by horse — and Omar said he instructed PWD to start work.

title: Billionaire Mark Cuban on why he does not drive Tesla: You've got to find ...
content: Mark Cuban prefers his Kia EV6 over his Tesla, citing user-friendliness, particularly the traditional turn signal design. Despite his preference, Cuban's teenage son isn't impressed, labeling the Kia a "nerd car." Cuban, a known critic of Elon Musk, has also playfully admitted to provoking Musk due to his perceived sensitivity.

title: Habeas corpus for daughter lands man in Pocso soup
content: The Madhya Pradesh high court has ordered a Pocso Act FIR against a man who sought his missing minor daughter's return. The girl, produced in court, accused him of sexual advances and expressed her desire to live with her female friend.

title: Witch-hunt, claim RG Kar doctors as some get 'punishment' jobs
content: Three senior resident doctors, prominent in the RG Kar movement, allege punitive postings in Bengal, triggering accusations of government witch-hunting and counselling process violations. Junior doctors, supported by senior medical bodies, plan protests after being denied clarification from officials. The affected doctors claim their preferred postings were altered due to their protest involvement, undermining the transparency of the allocation process.

title: Google DeepMind CEO 'warns' college students: World you entering will ...
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis predicts AGI within a decade, foreseeing workplace disruption alongside the creation of engaging new jobs. He advises students to immerse themselves in AI technologies, emphasizing adaptability and continuous learning. Hassabis highlights AI, VR, AR, and quantum computing as promising fields, urging students to combine passions with core skills to thrive in the evolving AI-driven landscape.

title: PM 'master distorian', using filmi dialogues to divert attention: Congress
content: Congress has criticized PM Modi, labeling him a "master distorian" for his remarks on Nehru and using "filmi" dialogues amidst the Pahalgam terror attack. The party questioned the failure to apprehend the perpetrators and the silence on Trump's ceasefire claims. Congress claims opposition MPs are effectively conveying India's anti-terrorism stance globally, contrasting it with BJP members allegedly spreading division.

title: Government proposes online registration of property, documents
content: The central government has drafted a bill to replace the 117-year-old Registration Act, introducing online property registration and mandating the registration of key documents. This initiative aims to modernize the registration process through electronic certificates, digital record maintenance, and Aadhaar-based authentication to reduce fraud and enhance information flow efficiency.

title: IMD sticks to forecast of above-normal monsoon
content: The IMD has updated its monsoon forecast, predicting 'above normal' rainfall for India, with 106% of the long period average. Most regions, including the monsoon core zone, are expected to receive above-normal rainfall, benefiting agriculture. June is also likely to be wetter than usual, potentially reducing heat wave days, though some southern and northeastern areas may see less rain.

title: Meitei protesters lock up CEO, GSI offices in Imphal
content: Protesters in Imphal locked down two central government offices following an incident where a state transport bus was forced to conceal the word "Manipur." This action escalated tensions, leading to demands for an apology from the governor, fueled by concerns over the state's identity.

title: Gateway jetty is good, SC says, refuses to intervene
content: The Supreme Court declined to halt construction of a passenger jetty and terminal near the Gateway of India, as the Bombay High Court is already reviewing the matter and scheduled to hear it on June 16. The court acknowledged the project's potential benefits for the city, similar to the coastal road.

title: After SC sacked 24,000 school staffers, West Bengal opens job window
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee announced a major school recruitment drive to fill 24,203 vacancies resulting from court rulings. Starting May 30, the process includes age relaxation and experience advantages for applicants. An additional 20,000 teaching positions will also be created.

title: At 50 ft for 3 hours: Chennai roller coaster malfunctions with 30 onboard
content: The Neelankarai police registered a case and launched an investigation into the amusement park’s safety practices.

title: Ghulam Nabi Azad, in Saudi for all-party MPs tour, hospitalised in Riyadh
content: Ghulam Nabi Azad, a former Union minister and part of an all-party MP delegation, was hospitalized in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, during their tour. Baijayant Jay Panda, the delegation leader, confirmed Azad's stable condition and ongoing medical supervision. The delegation will proceed to Algeria, missing Azad's presence as they engage with dignitaries and the Indian community.

title: Annoyed! Anushka Sharma can't hide disappointment as Virat Kohli walks back
content: Virat Kohli achieved his 63rd IPL fifty against Lucknow Super Giants in 2025, surpassing David Warner for the most half-centuries in IPL history. Rishabh Pant's explosive, unbeaten 118 propelled LSG to a massive 227. Despite Kohli's milestone and a strong start, RCB faltered after his dismissal, leaving Anushka Sharma visibly disappointed as the team struggled to chase the target.

title: Trump admin moves to cut $100 m in federal contracts for Harvard
content: The Trump administration is seeking to cancel approximately $100 million in the federal contracts with Harvard University, escalating its conflict with the institution. This action follows the cancellation of over $2.6 billion in research grants and is outlined in a draft letter from the General Services Administration. President Trump has criticized Harvard, alleging liberalism and antisemitism.

title: Ugly handshake! Pakistan player’s shocking gesture towards Indian tennis star
content: India triumphed over Pakistan in the Junior Davis Cup with a 2-0 victory, highlighted by Prkaash Sarran and Tavish Pahwa's singles wins. A video later emerged showing a Pakistani player's unsportsmanlike handshake, contrasting with the Indian player's calm reaction. After initially missing the handshake, the Pakistani player made contact the second time, only to pull away abruptly in a seemingly disrespectful manner.

title: Rishabh Pant slams ton without Sanjiv Goenka watching
content: Rishabh Pant's explosive, unbeaten century (118* off 61) and Mitchell Marsh's powerful 67 propelled Lucknow Super Giants to a formidable 227/3 against Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Pant, after a period of patchy form, rediscovered his rhythm, smashing 11 fours and 8 sixes, while Marsh continued his impressive run-scoring. Their game-changing 152-run partnership set the stage for LSG's imposing total.

title: Dipika Kakar on second-stage liver cancer; writes ‘I will walk out stronger’
content: Dipika Kakar, known for her role in Sasural Simar Ka, has revealed her stage 2 liver cancer diagnosis. Following hospitalization for persistent pain, doctors discovered a malignant tumor. Despite the challenging news, Dipika remains positive and determined, drawing strength from her family's support and the outpouring of prayers from fans.

title: New ITR filing deadline: What taxpayers need to do
content: Income Tax Return (ITR) Filing Deadline Extended: The CBDT has extended the ITR filing deadline for Assessment Year 2025-26 to September 15, 2025, due to system upgrades and ITR form revisions. This extension aims to simplify compliance, enhance transparency, and enable accurate reporting.

title: Toss drama! RCB captain hands over wrong team sheet
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru stand-in captain Jitesh Sharma won the toss and opted to bowl first against Lucknow Super Giants in Match 70 of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 at the Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium on Tuesday. RCB made two changes to their playing XI, with regular skipper Rajat Patidar still starting on the bench and likely to be used as an Impact Substitute. Despite recovering from injury, Josh Hazlewood was left out, while Liam Livingstone replaced Tim David and Nuwan Thushara came in for Lungi Ngidi.

title: 'Terrorists returning to their camps': BSF warns of possible infiltration attempts in J&K
content: The BSF reports terrorists are returning to camps in PoK after Operation Sindoor, raising concerns about potential infiltration attempts along the LoC and international border. Security forces remain vigilant, having recently thwarted drone attacks and eliminated several terrorists.

title: India sees gradual rise in Covid, officials urge care but say situation in control
content: India is experiencing a rise in Covid-19 cases across multiple states, prompting increased vigilance from health authorities. While the numbers are relatively low, Maharashtra and Karnataka are stepping up precautions, including mask advisories and hospital readiness. Experts attribute the rise to new sub-variants, but assure that infections are generally mild, with no evidence of severe illness.

title: Top 5 entertainment news of the day
content: Ready to dive into today’s juiciest entertainment scoop? From Akshay Kumar finally speaking up about Paresh Rawal’s Hera Pheri 3 exit, to a shocking trespass incident at Aditya Roy Kapur’s Mumbai home, and Juhi Chawla’s husband Jay Mehta revealing how people called him “crazy” for investing $75 million with Shah Rukh Khan in KKR — here’s your glam-packed scoop of the day!

title: Germany dethrones Japan as world’s top creditor after 34 years
content: In a historic shift, Germany has overtaken Japan as the world's leading creditor nation after 34 years, despite Japan's record ¥533.05 trillion in net external assets. Germany's substantial current account surplus, driven by strong trade, propelled it to the top with ¥569.7 trillion.

title: BJP spent Rs 57.6 crore in Delhi assembly elections, nearly 4 times more than AAP
content: In the February Delhi assembly poll, the BJP, securing victory with 48 seats, spent over Rs 57.6 crore on its election campaign. This significantly surpassed the Congress's Rs 46.2 crore and the AAP's Rs 14.5 crore expenditures. The BJP's receipts totalled Rs 88.7 crore, while the Congress and AAP received Rs 67.1 crore and Rs 16.

title: Aspergillus, the fungus that can eat you from inside out, is spreading- see why
content: A recent study from the University of Manchester reveals that climate change is facilitating the spread of harmful fungi, posing risks to both human health and food security. The research highlights the potential expansion of Aspergillus species into new regions like North America and Europe as temperatures rise.

title: Spy or lover? Nagpur woman's chats with Pakistan contacts raise questions
content: Sunita, a 43-year-old woman from Nagpur, faces espionage charges after being handed over by Pakistani authorities. She crossed the LoC to meet Pakistani contacts, raising suspicions of spying due to heightened tensions. Authorities are scrutinizing her communications, investigating whether her actions were driven by personal relationships or a larger espionage plot, while her son is being escorted back to Nagpur.

title: 'Iss baar camera ke samne kiya': PM Modi takes 'proof' jibe at opposition
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi targeted the opposition for demanding proof of military operations. He referenced Operation Sindoor and past strikes. Modi stated that terrorist actions are a planned war strategy by Pakistan. Congress leaders questioned why terrorists like Hafiz Saeed escaped. Rahul Gandhi accused the government of informing Pakistan before Operation Sindoor.

title: 'If states start ... ': SC pulls up UP govt for 'hijacking' Banke Bihari temple dispute
content: The Supreme Court has criticized the Uttar Pradesh government for interfering in a private dispute concerning the management of the Shri Banke Bihari temple in Vrindavan, accusing the state of overreach. The court questioned the state's involvement in the temple's redevelopment plan, particularly the allocation of funds without consulting those historically connected to the temple.

title: ITR filing AY 2025-26: Deadline to file returns extended - check new date
content: Good news for taxpayers. The Central Board of Direct Taxes has provided an extension for filing Income Tax Returns. The new deadline is September 15, 2025. This applies to returns originally due by July 31, 2025. The extension accommodates revisions in ITR forms. It also considers ongoing system development.

title: IMD predicts ‘above normal’ monsoon with 106% rainfall
content: India is projected to experience above-normal rainfall during the monsoon season from June to September, with 106% of the long period average. Central and peninsular India are expected to receive higher-than-usual rainfall, benefiting agriculture in the monsoon core zone. While northwest India anticipates normal rainfall, northeast India may experience below-normal rainfall.

title: Far-right anti-Islam activist Tommy Robinson freed early from prison
content: Tommy Robinson, co-founder of the far-right English Defence League, was released from prison four months early, sparking immediate reactions. He had been jailed for contempt of court after breaching an injunction related to false claims against a Syrian refugee. Despite Justice Johnson noting a lack of remorse, Robinson's demonstrated commitment to complying with the injunction led to the sentence reduction.

title: Canada launches citizenship week: 87K Indians had obtained citizenship in 2024
content: Canada's Citizenship Week highlights the significance of Canadian citizenship, with 3.74 lakh individuals granted citizenship in 2024. Indian nationals comprised the largest group, accounting for 23% of new citizens, marking a significant increase from the previous year. Despite lower immigration targets set for the coming years, India remains the largest source country for permanent residents.

title: Tej Pratap breaks silence after family ouster, congratulates Tejashwi on newborn son
content: Tej Pratap Yadav congratulated his brother Tejashwi on the birth of his second child, a son, after being expelled from the RJD by his father, Lalu Prasad Yadav, for revealing a long-term relationship and citing moral values. Tejashwi supported his father's decision, emphasizing personal freedom while upholding the party's dedication to the people of Bihar.

title: Liverpool car-ramming attack: Why such incidents are hard to prevent
content: Yet the incident adds to a growing list of ramming attacks that have plagued cities across the globe—from Vancouver to Munich, Magdeburg to New Orleans and Zhuhai. In just the past six months, such attacks have killed 71 people, according to the National Transportation Security Center.

title: Why Trump wants to take $3 billion from Harvard and give it to US trade schools
content: US President Trump announced plans to redirect $3 billion in federal grants from Harvard University to trade schools nationwide. The move targets research funding frozen over concerns about antisemitism and foreign student policies. While Harvard faces legal battles and remains silent, vocational education leaders applaud the shift. The controversy highlights ongoing debates about the future of higher education and funding priorities in the US.

title: Jaipur Police supports victims of crime by linking them to benefactors
content: Contributions include sponsoring the education of affected children, skill development for adults, and monthly assistance until families achieve self-sufficiency

title: All-party delegation led by MP Kanimozhi arrives in Greece
content: The delegation reached Athens from Slovenia, where it called on senior officials and emphasised India's "new normal" of zero tolerance against cross-border terrorism

title: INDIA bloc to seek special session on Pahalgam attack
content: They are finalising a draft of the letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the issue; they want discussion on the attack and the subsequent developments both nationally and internationally

title: WB government to start fresh recruitment as well as push for review petition before SC simultaneously, says Mamata
content: Fresh hiring for over 44,000 posts is set to begin by May 30 as directed by apex court, while parallel review will be sought for over 25,000 whose appointments were cancelled over ‘tainted’ selection.

title: Om Birla nominates Sambit Patra, two other Lok Sabha members to Press Council
content: Besides Patra, Shiv Sena member Naresh Mhaske and Congress member Kali Charan Munda have been nominated to the Press Council

title: Sequenced COVID-19 samples in Tamil Nadu in were of Omicron and its sub-lineages: Director of Public Health
content: Reiterating that there was no need for panic, Dr. T.S. Selvavinayagam says if any one has displays symptoms, especially persons with co-morbidities or the elderly, immediate medical help must be sought at hospitals

title: BSF’s border management system shows encouraging results during Operation Sindoor: IG Shashank Anand
content: Fencing with sensors allows real-time monitoring in tough terrain, says IG; will work to improve limitations in the counter-drone system, as this is a major challenge during Operation Sindoor, says DIG

title: ‘Mane Manege Police’ initiative to bridge the gap between the force and citizens
content: Parameshwara says the beat police will visit houses, interact with people and help resolve the issues being faced by them

title: BSF foils Bangladeshi nationals’ bid to enter India
content: The incident took place in western Assam during the reported deportation of 14 Bangladeshi nationals who were staying in India illegally

title: Applications for arts and science colleges to be open till May 30
content: The merit list for special category students will be released on May 29, and the one for general category students will be out on May 30

title: Varanasi court rejects plea against Rahul over his remarks on Lord Ram in U.S.
content: Plea accused Cong. leader of referring to Lord Ram as a “mythological and fictional character,” and said the same had  hurt the religious sentiments of Hindus

title: Manipur shall remain ‘indivisible’, say Meitei groups
content: Coordination Committee on Manipur Integrity (COCOMI) conveys people’s convention resolution on Manipur’s indivisible identity, Centre’s role in crisis, public anger about President’s Rule; FOCS calls for “moral reframing” of the crisis

title: Check dams, causeway across Kaundinya river in Vellore inaugurated
content: The two check dams are expected to boost irrigation and recharge groundwater. Residents say the bridge puts an end to their ordeal of having to take a detour of at least 20 km to reach key towns

title: CBI gets published Interpol Silver Notices against two fugitives
content: Silver Notice was launched in January 2025 as part of a pilot involving 51 countries and territories. The new colour-coded notice enables sharing of alerts and requests for information on assets of wanted criminals

title: NHRC notice to Haryana over journalist’s murder
content: The journalist was working with an online news portal and was out for a walk after dinner when unidentified assailants shot him and fled from the spot on May 18, 2025

title: Protesters lock Central govt. offices in Manipur
content: Stir intensifies; offices of the Geological Survey of India and State’s Chief Electoral Officer sealed; Imphal is on the boil since May 20, when security personnel allegedly insulted State’s identity

title: Mt. Khangchendzonga ascent hurtful to indigenous communities: Sikkim CM to Amit Shah
content: A team from the National Institute of Mountaineering and Adventure Sports in Arunachal Pradesh scaled the world’s third-highest peak on May 18 from the Nepal side

title: CRPF official, held for spying, says he was trapped into it
content: Info, photos shared with Pakistani handlers still on arrested ASI’s phone, says source; his last posting was in Pahalgam; he was approached on social media, received about ₹3,000 per month from foreign account

title: 117 year-old Registration Act to be replaced
content: Draft law, placed on Department of Land Resources’ website for public feedback, aims for greater accessibility with plain language and transparent procedures for citizens, as well as online registration

title: UDF leadership meeting brushes aside concerns about Anvar’s demands
content: Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan asks Anvar to decide whether he should cooperate with UDF’s bypoll campaign in Nilambur

title: Heavy rains lash Vemulawada and parts of Rajanna Sircilla district
content: Devotees faced severe inconvenience as they had to wade through knee-deep water to reach the temple due to heavy rain on Tuesday evening

title: Counter negative campaign on procurement, CM tells Collectors
content: Government spent ₹12,184 crore and the amounts were credited into the farmers’ accounts within 48 hours, the CM pointed out

title: DRUCC members seek more passenger amenities, extension of trains
content: Introduction of new trains and additional train stoppages in Guntur division were among the matters discussed in the meeting

title:
A show that spotlights the pomological
diversity of Tamil Nadu for 65 years
content:
Three major shows organised as part of the summer festival in the Nilgiris every year — the flower show, the vegetable show, and the fruit show — were held as a single event when the first flower show was conducted in the late 1800s. Only recently did the fruit show move to the Sims Park in Coonoor, drawing 
lakhs of tourists every year

title: Kerala HC enhances compensation for young road accident victim to ₹53 lakh
content: Sumisha of Thrissur, now aged 26, was only seven years old when she met with an accident in 2006 and has since been living in an orphanage

title: UDF refuses to blink as Anvar sets 48-hour deadline for concrete political accommodation in alliance
content: He terms UDF’s offer to billet him as an “associate member” in the alliance as amorphous, says TMC reserves the right to recalibrate the party’s political tack in Nilambur bypoll. Satheesan says UDF’s reciprocation will hinge on Anvar’s cooperation

title: CM urges students, teachers to join hands in fight against drug menace
content: ‘The fight has to be part of the main activities to be undertaken in the new academic year in both the general and higher education sectors,’ says the Chief Minister

title: RGUKT students earn highest number of NPTEL certifications in January-April semester
content: Out of 11,755 students from four RGUKT campuses who enrolled for 40 courses, 10,773 received certificates, says Registrar

title: ‘Not found suitable’ is new Manuvaad: Rahul Gandhi
content: Indicating that the term is a euphemism for casteism, Mr. Gandhi says 60% of reserved professor posts being kept vacant by claiming that eligible SC, ST, OBC candidates were ‘not found suitable’

title: Rahim gets 20-year RI in murder case; likely to be released next year
content: Riyadh Criminal Court sentences him to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment; He is likely to be released in December 2026 as he has already completed 19 years in prison

title: State GST department busts spurious diesel network
content: SGST department conducts raids on spurious diesel racket causing tax loss, environmental damage, and possible money laundering activities

title: When Jayalalithaa walked out of the National Development Council meeting
content: On December 27, 2012, Chief Minister Jayalalithaa walked out of the 57th NDC meeting. She was upset that she could not complete her speech, though every Chief Minister was allotted 10 minutes. She accused the Centre of stifling the voice of the Chief Ministers. But the Centre denied that it had discriminated against non-Congress Chief Ministers

title: Water level in Idukki reservoir increases by over 2.72 ft in 24 hours
content: Rain-related incidents from May 24 to 27 resulted in one death and destruction of 25 houses in Idukki district

title: Indian X accounts withheld after Operation Sindoor restored
content: X accounts belonging to content creators, journalists and publications in India were restored over the last few days, before the blockings were up for hearing in court

title: CPI(M) condemns demolition of houses in Tirupati Urban mandal
content: Alleging that hired goons razed the houses belonging to the poor, party leader urges authorities to render justice to the victims

title: Pradyot urges restraint as row erupts over DM’s refusal to meet TIPRA Motha leaders
content: TIPRA Motha supporters criticise Gomati DM; CPI(M), Congress slam official’s conduct; royal scion calls for calm and communal harmony

title: Government mulls 15-year stay requirement for Ladakh domicile tag
content: The new policy under consideration says that an ‘outsider’ who has settled in Ladakh after its special status was struck down in 2019 can become a domicile only in 2034

title: IMD retains ‘above normal’ rainfall outlook for monsoon
content: Monsoon likely to slow down as it moves towards Delhi and northern India, but speedy advance may spare the capital from heatwaves, say IMD officials; rain-fed agri zone to get 6% more rain than usual

title: WNBA can't verify hateful comments toward Reese
content: The WNBA said it was unable to substantiate allegations of "hateful fan comments" directed toward Angel Reese during a game against the Fever.

title: Pacers' Nesmith (ankle) available for Game 4
content: Pacers forward Aaron Nesmith is available to play in Game 4 against the Knicks on Tuesday after sustaining a right ankle sprain in Game 3.

title: Rudolph, amid QB noise: 'Good to be wanted'
content: QB Mason Rudolph, who returned to the Steelers on a two-year deal after playing with the Titans in 2024, said "it's good be wanted."

title: Falcons begin OTAs without absent QB Cousins
content: Falcons quarterback Kirk Cousins was absent from practice at voluntary organized team activities Tuesday.

title: Chase: Preseason a factor in Bengals' slow starts
content: Bengals receiver Ja'Marr Chase quipped that the team's starters need to play in the preseason to help prevent slow starts that have plagued the team in recent years.

title: UGA's Smart: SEC coaches want clarity on portal
content: Georgia football coach Kirby Smart made it clear Tuesday that there's one issue of paramount important to the SEC's football coaches -- clarity on the future of the NCAA transfer portal.

title: Broncos will induct D. Thomas into Ring of Fame
content: Demaryius Thomas, a five-time Pro Bowl selection who died in 2021 and whose signature smile was as big a part of his legacy with the Denver Broncos as his long list of big plays, will be inducted into the team's Ring of Fame during the 2025 season.

title: Nicklaus surprised McIlroy skipped the Memorial
content: Jack Nicklaus said Tuesday he was surprised Rory McIlroy decided to skip the Memorial for the first time since 2017 and that he hasn't spoken to him since McIlroy won the Masters.

title: 📈 Ranking top 25 NBA free agents: Who's No. 1?
content: Will LeBron James opt in or sign a new deal? Can Indy keep Myles Turner? We're breaking down what's next for 25 star free agents.

title: A hidden stat is deciding the NBA's conference finals
content: The most important plays of Knicks-Pacers and Thunder-Timberwolves are happening nowhere near the basket.

title: The NFL season is almost here ... sort of: 100 days out, we have storylines, predictions and players to know
content: There are 100 days until the 2025  season kicks off. Let's celebrate with 100 big thoughts, predictions, stats and situations to watch.

title: Power Rankings: Storm surge while Fever fall in latest edition
content: Indiana's losses drop the Fever while Seattle's three-win streak bumps up the Storm in our latest 1-13 ranking.

title: Caitlin Clark injury reaction: What's next for Indiana Fever star
content: The Fever announced Clark will miss at least two weeks with a quad strain. What's next for Clark and her team?

title: Who has the early edge for MVP, Cy Young and more? Inside the numbers on MLB's biggest awards
content: With Memorial Day weekend behind us, it's time to take our first look at the leaders for MVP, Cy Young and more.

title: Memorial Day standings check: Playoff predictions, biggest surprises, more
content: Our experts look at the best and worst of the season to date -- and predict which teams will rule from here on out.

title: The decline of a dynasty: The Patriots had a 'difficult' two seasons. Can Mike Vrabel reignite them?﻿
content: The Patriots have revamped their front office, coaching personnel and roster after back-to-back 4-13 seasons in hopes of closing the gap in the AFC East.

title: Ranking all head coaches as players
content: There are small-school studs and a Heisman winner. There's a national title QB and one of the best ever.

title: Is this the last time we'll see line judges at a Grand Slam?
content: The French Open is the last of the majors to use human line judges -- and it's been a topic of debate in Paris.

title: Summer transfers each top Premier League club should make
content: All of the big Premier League clubs need to make big moves in this summer transfer window -- even the good ones. Here's what they should do.

title: It's Good Guy vs. Bad Guy on Season 33 of 'The Ultimate Fighter'
content: UFC Hall of Famers Daniel Cormier and Chael Sonnen break down what to expect from this season of TUF.

title: LaLiga awards: The Year of Yamal as Barça dominate
content: With the sun set on LaLiga for 2024-25, ESPN hands out silverware for the best and worst of the season. No prizes for guessing who hogs the headlines.

title: Ian Darke's Premier League season grades: How well did the 20 teams do?
content: Which teams passed and which failed to make the grade during the 2024-25 season? Ian Darke has the answers.

title: Sources: Man United trigger Cunha release clause
content: Wolverhampton Wanderers have given Manchester United permission to conclude a deal for Matheus Cunha, sources told ESPN.

title: LAFC great Vela retires, named club ambassador
content: Former Mexico and LAFC forward Carlos Vela announced his retirement from soccer on Tuesday, with the 36-year-old to become LAFC's first club ambassador.

title: Man faces attempted murder charge in Liverpool
content: A man has been arrested on suspicion of attempted murder after a car collided with pedestrians shortly after Liverpool's Premier League victory parade on Sunday.

title: Pellegrini: Antony wanted 'revenge' after Utd exit
content: Brazilian winger Antony wanted "revenge" when he arrived on loan at Real Betis after struggling to live up to his hefty price tag at Manchester United, Betis head coach Manuel Pellegrini said Tuesday.

title: Barça phenom Yamal inks new long-term contract
content: Lamine Yamal has agreed a new long-term contract with Barcelona until 2031, the Spanish champions announced on Tuesday.

title: Messi partners with Suárez to launch new team
content: Luis Suárez and Lionel Messi have been partners on the pitch for several years. Now they're teaming up off it as businessmen.

title: KC Current owners go global, acquire Danish club
content: Kansas City Current owners Angie and Chris Long are expanding their soccer ventures globally with the purchase of Danish club HB Køge.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City eyeing move for Cherki
content: Manchester City are keeping tabs ahead of a possible move for Lyon's Rayan Cherki. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Goodbye Manchester, hello trophies: Nine ex-United stars who won elsewhere in 2024-25
content: Scott McTominay won an MVP prize in Italy, Dean Henderson won the FA Cup with Crystal Palace, and either Jadon Sancho or Antony will win the UEFA Europa Conference League crown this week. Who else cast out by United has thrived this season?

title: Bullpen stock watch: Andrés Muñoz remains the perfect closer
content: Everything fantasy baseball managers need to know about which closers should be added, dropped and more.

title: Waiver wire: Three hitters to add power to your infield
content: Todd Zola outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire and lineup tips for your roster.

title: Emerging Valkyries pickups to stream
content: Veronica Burton and Kayla Thornton highlight some of the top fantasy women's basketball streamers for the week of May 26.

title: Trump Says 'Golden Dome' Free For Canada If It Joins As 51st US State
content: President Donald Trump said Tuesday that Canada could join his proposed "Golden Dome" missile defense system for free -- but only if it becomes part of the United States.

title: "After Losing Wars, Pak Chose Terrorism To Target India": Indian Delegation In Congo
content: BJP leader SS Ahluwalia, part of the all-party delegation led by Shiv Sena MP Shrikant Shinde, scathingly criticised Pakistan, stating that it has repeatedly used terrorism as a weapon against India after losing three wars.

title: 4 Of Family Killed As Auto-Rickshaw Collides With Bus In UP: Cops
content: Four members of a family were killed after their auto rickshaw was hit by a government bus here on Tuesday evening, police said.

title: Bangladesh Islamist Leader On Death Row For 1971 War Crimes Acquitted
content: Bangladesh's Supreme Court on Tuesday acquitted a senior Jamaat-e-Islami leader, overturning his death sentence by the International Crimes Tribunal (ICT) in a war crimes case related to the 1971 Liberation War against Pakistan.

title: Satellite Pics: Did India Target Underground Facility at Pak's Murid Air Base?
content: New high-resolution satellite images, accessed by NDTV, show extensive damage to the Murid air base of Pakistan, showing a three-metre-wide crater just 30 metres from an underground facility of the Pakistan Air Force.

title: Hindu Group Leader Arrested For Provocative Remarks In Karnataka
content: Mangaluru police on Tuesday arrested Vishwa Hindu Parishad leader Sharan Pumpwell for allegedly making provocative remarks and inciting unrest following the murder of Hindutva activist Suhas Shetty earlier this month, officials said.

title: Delhi Announces Pensions For People Jailed During Emergency
content: The BJP government in Delhi will provide pensions to those who were political prisoners during the Emergency and felicitate them, Chief Minister Rekha Gupta said on Tuesday.

title: Why Donald Trump Cannot Build The Golden Dome Without Canada
content: Canada has a large airspace that offers the US an important line of sight for the US sensors to shoot down missiles from China and Russia. Moreover, historically, Canada has played a big role in air and missile defence for North America.

title: Video: 3 Men Made To Sit On Road As Andhra Cops Hit Them With Sticks
content: Three men, with their legs at full stretch, are made to sit in the middle of the road on Tenali highway in Andhra Pradesh. Scores of policemen surround them. The cops beat them up publicly to teach the men a lesson.

title: Meitei Group COCOMI Meets Home Ministry, Asks To Act Against "Anti-Peace Elements"
content: A delegation of a Meitei civil society group from Manipur on Tuesday conveyed to the Centre its strong sentiments over a recent incident where the state's name written on the windshield of a bus was covered with a white paper.

title: Ghulam Nabi Azad, Part Of India's Outreach Delegation, Admitted To Hospital
content: Former minister Ghulam Nabi Azad, who is part of an all-party delegation, has been admitted to a hospital and is now under medical supervision, BJP MP Baijayant Jay Panda said on Tuesday.

title: 'Submitted Documents On Illegal Immigrants': Manipur Ex Chief Minister After Meeting Governor
content: Former Manipur Chief Minister N Biren Singh on Tuesday said he discussed the prevailing situation in the state with Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla and asked him to invite the protesters for talks to resolve the Gwaltabi incident.

title: 9 New Covid Cases Reported In Rajasthan In 24 Hours
content: Rajasthan reported nine new Covid-19 cases, including a 16-day-old infant, in the past 24 hours, taking the total number of cases this year to 32.

title: Karnataka BJP Chief Demands Apology From Kamal Haasan For "Disrespecting" Kannada
content: Karnataka BJP President B Y Vijayendra said on Tuesday accused actor Kamal Haasan of "disrespecting" Kannada in his effort to glorify his own mother tongue.

title: Has Trump's Team Paused Students' Visa Interviews Globally? US Says...
content: This directive was sent out worldwide to diplomats, amid the administration's efforts to restrict the entry of foreign students in America allegedly over claims stating that they have contributed to an anti-semitic atmosphere.

title: Ex-IAF Chief On India's Stealth Fighter Jet Plan And China-Pak Axis
content: India has taken a step forward in the direction of building an indigenous fifth-generation stealth fighter jet, an ambitious project aimed at bolstering the Indian Air Force's air power capability.

title: Why Expel Him: Brother Of Woman In Tej Pratap Yadav's Deleted Post Targets Lalu Yadav
content: Akash Yadav, the brother of Anushka Yadav, the woman at the heart of Tej Pratap Yadav's expulsion from his party and family, has lashed out against Rashtriya Janata Dal chief Lalu Yadav and his political heir Tejashwi Yadav.

title: "Couldn't Be Happier": Vaccine-Hating US Health Chief Ends Select Covid Jabs
content: COVID-19 vaccines are no longer recommended in the United States for children and pregnant women who are healthy, US Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Junior, who has been a staunch critic of vaccines in general, has announced.

title: "Your Language (Kannada) Was Born Out Of Tamil": Kamal Haasan Comment Sparks Row
content: Tamil megastar Kamal Haasan, weeks before the release of his latest film, Thug Life, has teed off a fresh controversy with his "your language (Kannada) was born out of Tamil" remark at an event in Chennai.

title: Kerala Shrine Body Dissolves Temple Panel Over Rendition Of RSS 'Gana Geetham'
content: The Travancore Devaswom Board (TDB), the top temple body in Kerala's Travancore region, dissolved the advisory committee of a temple following the rendition of the RSS 'gana geetham' (prayer song) during a recent musical concert held there.
